text:
It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no two individuals who have lived in the same environment or under similar circumstances will have had exactly the same experiences. It is important, therefore, for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces where necessary.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1924, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether they be in Old Province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Western Canadian Pioneers' Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days: What Did They Do?"

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 2, entitled "Pioneer Days: What Did They Do?"

All questionnaires are available at the Saskatchewan Archives Board's offices at the University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Provincial Archives Collection, and will be made available to researchers.

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
1. Your full name: [Name]
2. Your address: [Address]
3. Date: [Date]
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country)
5. What was your father's name and occupation?
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year)
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child")
9. What were your reasons for coming West?

[Handwritten answers]

1. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it?)

[Handwritten answers]
Rutledge, George Horace
214 - 29th St. W., Saskatoon.

To Sask. - May, 1905.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

1. Your full name: George O. Horace Rutledge
2. Your address: 214 - 29th St. W., Saskatoon
3. Date: March 20, 1905
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country)
   Grimsby, Ontario
5. What was your father's name and occupation?
   James Edgar Rutledge, Farmer
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year)
   May, 1905
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.
   Milwaukee, Wisconsin, U.S.A. 1884
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you were rather old or you may use "I was a small child", I was in my teens", etc.)
   26
9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   Details of conditions for the farming

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)
    Through all available information
12. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

My thoughts would be more comfortable if I

13. What means of transportation did you use?

By train to Saskatchewan.

14. What incidents of the journey west do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

I enjoyed the trip.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Mennonite Hall, Saskatoon.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

E 18 359

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Saskatoon

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?
21. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   *My thought I would be more comfortable if I stayed where I came.*

22. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, etc.)?
    *Myself*

23. What means of transportation did you use?
    *By train to Saskatoon. Then walked to demovat to look over the country.*

24. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
    *Marquis Hotel, Saskatoon*

25. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
    *Marquis Hotel, Saskatoon*

26. Where did you settle or take up land?
    *Ex 15 35 9*

27. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
    *Saskatoon*

28. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?
    *Farmer*
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came west tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

25. Any other comments you wish to make about your experiences?
3.

12. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

Once a week for awhile.

20. If you are married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

Elgie & Ethel Prins Dec. 29, 1915. Saskatoon

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? It was a place to settle.

not that I know of

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.

Parents came to live with me, 1908

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

Help to Rogers and always try to economize

Saskatchewan Library
23. When was the first car used in the household? 1917

24. If you owned a car before 1916, when did you buy it? 1915

34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1947? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here, giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combine, organizing the first league, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School district, Post Office, Villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.). Try to give: (1) name and composition of person suggesting place-name; (2) origin and meaning of the new name; (3) date of its adoption; (4) any changes in names since the first name was given; (5) date and reason for change. Give three of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).

39. How did the places in your community get their names? (School district, Post Office, Villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.). Try to give: (1) name and composition of person suggesting place-name; (2) origin and meaning of the new name; (3) date of its adoption; (4) any changes in names since the first name was given; (5) date and reason for change. Give three of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1924? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1920s? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here, giving date wherever possible (such as owning the first automobile, combining the first tractor, organizing the first club, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, Post offices, villages, railway stations, streets, hills, etc.) Try to give (1) name and occupation of person originating place-name; (2) origin and meaning of the name; (3) date of its adoption; (4) any changes in name and date the first name was given; date and reason for change. Give facts of how much as above in (1), (2), (3).
